turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: So, what are we waiting for?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Cool your jets...I'm doing a little damage control.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Damage control!  What kind of damage? What's going on Barnes!

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: You're not helping my heart condition any, Barnes!  Now just what the hell are you dragging your ass for?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The others decided to get cute with me, so I'm teaching them a lesson!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: This ship is going down in a blaze of glory!

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well blaze your ass out of there! You've completely altered your trajectory, are we linking up or not?!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Don't worry about me, I'm changing coordinates now.  I've come to far to be tripped up by some Dudley do-right... motherfuckers!

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well if you knew it then why did set your thrusters on before making the calculation?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I told you, I had to teach a few people a lesson!

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Goddamn it Barnes this really steams my onions!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Let's get something straight, Chappy!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Now I got enough air and supplies to make another complete orbit in the pod!  You're just gonna have to pick me up later.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: This is a major screw up on your part, goddamn it!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Is that clear?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: That's clear.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Good.  Now you'll hear from me when I have the new coordinates. In the meantime don't bug me.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Sheesh!  Aye aye cap'n!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Over and out!

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: Look at this...Jesus.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, I guess money don't buy class.

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: No.  But it buys a lot of other things.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like that piece of ass he was with.

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: Well...I don't mind.  I can put up with it.  I'm taking six months off after this, and I won't have to deal with people snapping their fingers at me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not me.  I'm in for the long haul. In nine months I'll have enough to take a few years off.

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: Well, more power to you.  Me, I start to bug out after too much time out here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't have a problem with it. Besides, you get to meet a lot of interesting people.

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: What's the use...we're gonna die...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't say that!  It ain't over till it's over!

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: We're going to die.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you shut up already?

turns.speaker: CARLO
turns.text: It's getting hard to breathe...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just don't move around too much.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Oh right, right you're on that research grant.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Ryan Taylor, first mate.  Welcome aboard.  First time in space?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Yes.  Theoretical discoveries aside, there's nothing like the real thing. How about you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: This is my second commercial flight.  I used to run satellite freighters but that got old fast.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: So you were looking for a new challenge.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, plus the money ain't that bad. DAWN So, tell me, do you think everyone gets their million dollars' worth on this trip of a lifetime?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, let me put it this way.  Most of the cost is due to safety reasons. Most people are not familiar with space travel, so we have to take extra precautions in the event they do something careless.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Like open an airlock by mistake?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well I don't think there's a chance of that happening.  It's usually the moon walks.  Sometimes you feel like a kindergarten teacher.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Well I hope I don't do anything careless.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm sure you'll be all right.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Actually I've logged about 200 hours of simulated space walking at the institute, mostly related to starship construction.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Still, I hope I behave on the moon.  I'll stick close to you.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: We don't.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Well maybe there's a way out of here.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Fat chance of that.  Even if we had C4 and a laser torch these doors wouldn't budge.  That son of a bitch...that stupid son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Given a malfunction, how would a rescue team get you out if the doors won't open?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Probably come through the wall I suppose.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Well maybe we can do something like that.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't think you know what you're talking about.  Besides, what could we use for tools?  A steak knife?  A corkscrew?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Just considering our options... sir.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Supposing we could get out of this room?  Is there anything we could do to reach the bridge?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It depends on the condition of the ship.  If I could get to one of the suit compartments I could check the exterior air locks for a possible entry.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Can't we access the mainframe to check the ship's condition?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: With what?  How am I going to interface with it?  I need to be able to talk to the system and to have the system talk to me.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: OK...it's open.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Seen one like it before?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Sure. It complies with all standard construction codes.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Damn it.  If only we could get to those suits... Dawn then thinks of something -

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Why can't we?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know the condition of the compartments.  Depending on damage, debris...could be a fatal mistake.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: And suppose you couldn't hold out?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Suppose you didn't have to hold your breath?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: We could send Mac.  If he can retrieve one suit, we could go back for the other.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: He certainly is polite.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Close every door behind you!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: It must be oxygenated if we can hear him.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yeah, let's hope he can find a way through.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: If I could get to the bridge I could send the distress signal.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Even if we do, it might be too late.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Everyone just stay put.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I can't let you do that.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Look I know what I'm doing. I have experience and training in space walking.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Simulated space walking.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know what we're facing.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Are you ready?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Ready as I'll ever be.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Yeah.  We did it.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: So we did.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: You're ready for the real thing?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: At this point I'm ready for anything.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Be careful, you don't want to puncture the suit.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Don't worry about me.  Where are we going?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Explosive?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: One of Barnes' duds, luckily for us.  Take this out of the equation right now...

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Taylor?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: What do you think's going to happen to us?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, Dawn, I'm an optimist by nature.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Yeah, but you didn't answer my question.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Do you want some advice?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Don't worry about what will happen, just concentrate on what is happening.  You'll live longer.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Words to live by.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Dawn!  Dawn!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Helllp!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I guess I owe you a debt of gratitude.  You saved my life.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It was no time to lose my partner. We're going to have to hurry, he's on to us.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Oh my God.  What happened?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: The room is filled with poison gas.  The hydraulic system must have blown.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: A schematic of the ship.  Looking for a lifeline to the pods.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: We don't have enough suits to get the others out.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That's why we need a safe passage. remember what you said earlier, about getting through the wall? That might just be our ticket.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Take this flare.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: A flare?  A flare won't do it.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: A little dab'll do ya. Now you know how to get there, right?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Why?  Where are you going?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm not going with you.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: What?  What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: There's only room on that pod for seven.  That's you and the others.  I'm counting on you to get them out of there.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: And what are you going to do?!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm going to try and buy you some time.  I can get to the bridge from here.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: But how are you going to escape?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Don't worry about me.  There's still a chance I can issue a distress signal.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: But you can't be sure!  It's suicide.  You have to come with us!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I can't!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I will once I get past the bulkhead.  Good luck.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: You too.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Dawn.  Come in.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Taylor!  Where are you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm in the bridge.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Barnes?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: He's out of the equation.  Talk to me.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I'm about to blow the wall.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Hurry.  You have to get them out of there!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: How does the distress signal look?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Uh, it's ok, everything's going to be ok...now I'm counting on you, and whatever you do keep calm, we don't want them to panic.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I'll do my best.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: So what's going to happen to you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I'm staying with the ship.  I'll be all right.  Now hurry.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Thanks for everything, Taylor. Will I see you again?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Hopefully sooner than later.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Sooner than later.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Over and out.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: We have room!  Let's go!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What do you mean?  What happened!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: We don't have time.  I'll explain later, hurry!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: So close...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: And so far.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I never thought this would happen.  No premonitions, nothing.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It did.  It is.  There's nothing we can do about that.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Except write our wills.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Will you marry me?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Marry you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: That's right.  Will you marry me?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I would, but no one can perform the ceremony.  I guess it doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: It would matter to us.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: In that case, I accept.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Good.  In that case, I pronounce us man and wife.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Right now it's about 8 o'clock at home.  People are going to work, kids are going to school...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Try not to think about it.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: What is it?!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I don't know.  Wave to them!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Congratulations on your...recent award.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Is there anything I can help you with?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: No, just enjoying the view.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well, there's no better to way to see the world, than with us.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: So I've been told.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well if you need anything, please feel free to ask me.  Just a reminder we have fabulous cuisine available 24 hours in the earthrise room, and a large selection of vintage wines here in our ship bar.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Yes Mac, but the guests are requesting it.  It will reduce the level of negative feedback.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That is one of my priorities.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What is happening around here!!!

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: There's no time to explain.  Get everyone together!  We found a way to the pods!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where's Taylor?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: He's up on the bridge!  He's going to be OK.  Now who's missing?

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: Carlo!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: DAWN
turns.text: I'm going back for Taylor!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you nuts!  It's too risky!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I'm homesick.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Homesick?  It's only been two days!

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: We should have gone to Nassau. At least we could go swimming, lie on the beach.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Ah hell we can always do that. Listen believe me, once we get to the moon, your tone is going to change.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How is it going to be different from this?  Go see some boring footprint under glass?

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Look you were the one who wanted to do something different, something to tell all your friends.  Any chump can go to Nassau.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Look around you baby, we're rubbing elbows with royalty, oil sheiks, this is class.  You'll be envied by everyone.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Besides I can't wait to tee off on the sea of tranquillity. That should shore up that prick Hank Drexler.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Oh no...I think there's carrots in here...

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Send it back if you don't want it.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: Well now what are we gonna do!

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: How am I supposed to know?

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: You're Delbert Miles!  You have more clout than some whacked out pilot!  Talk to him!

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Talk to him...Jesus...

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: It's getting too cold in here.  I can't stand this anymore!

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Baby, take it easy.

turns.speaker: MONICA
turns.text: How can you sit there with your fat stomach and tell me to take it easy!  I want to go home!  I want to be warm!  I want to get out of here!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look.  We're talking about life and death here.  I don't know why we're even having this conversation.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Well what would you know about it? You don't have anything to lose.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're gonna give him those bank codes, you know why?  Because I'm telling you to, that's why.  I'm not losing my life over some greedy pig.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Who are you calling a pig, rummy?

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: I haven't quite made up my mind yet.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll tell you what you're gonna do.  You're gonna stay put like Taylor said.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: Again with the orders from you! You got a Napoleon complex chief, and I'm getting sick of it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you going to do about it?

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: I tell you, something's not right here.  How do we know they're not going to use the pod for themselves?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because, Taylor wouldn't do that, that's why.

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: What makes you so sure?

turns.speaker: DELBERT
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The engines!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Officer Taylor, how are you this evening?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Mac.  What's shaking?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Mac, I have a favor to ask you. Mac looks at Taylor -

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Certainly.  If you need anything, please feel free to ask me.  Just a reminder we have fabulous cuisine available --

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yes I know all that.  Mac, I need you to help us out with a little technical problem.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Certainly.  I have a full working knowledge of the ships operations.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Right, I understand that...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I need you to actually do something for me.  I need to access your CPU, directly.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That will not be necessary.  You can simply speak to me.  I understand most languages fluently.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yeah but the ship's mainframe doesn't. I need you to tell it something.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Alteration of my central processing unit should be done only by an authorized service dealer.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I know but we're in a bind.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Now Mac, can you tell me the status of this deck?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: One moment please...  one moment please...

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: But the corridor outside this door is open, correct?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Yes.  You can enjoy some wonderful views from there.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Mac, what about the suit compartments on this level?  Can they be accessed?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm sorry.  The suit compartments are in a non-oxygenated, zero gravity atmosphere.  I'm afraid that's off limits to all passengers.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Ok Mac...  I'll talk to you on this. I want to find a way to get to the bridge, then I want you to come back.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Certainly.  Anything I can do to be of service.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: How is it looking, Mac?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I would recommend a maintenance crew in this sector.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Is it safe for human transport?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's affirmative.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: I'm an addict. I can't go through a day without the stuff. Theo reaches over and pours for him with a steady hand.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: You're not from around here, are you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm from Akron.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm looking for a man.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: What kind of man?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: A bowler.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: 99 years, 241 days,  15 hours, and 20 minutes of no bowling. Alfie shuffles up to the self-serve island and begins wiping it down.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: Find your bowler?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yeah, but it didn't go so good. He wasn't the man I thought he'd be. Theo is trying to affix the lid on his cup, but his hands are trembling, spilling some of the coffee.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: My father used to say to me "Never..." no, hmmm. "Always..." No, no...  Ah! Love and hate are blood relations.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe I should have left the ball in the car.

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: Did you hear about that bowler who got smeared? I saw them pull a body bag out of the alley. I heard he was kacked but good. They had to take apart the pin machine to get him out.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The pin machine?

turns.speaker: ALFIE
turns.text: Just like Junior did the last time; lane six. All's I know is it's gonna be a closed coffin. My advice to you is to lay low. He puts on a pair of dark 7-Eleven shades, flips up his collar and skulks away.

turns.speaker: ALFREDA
turns.text: You a mini-golfer?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: ALFREDA
turns.text: Paradise, huh? Might be one of the new putt-putts off route 99. Theo turns to leave.

turns.speaker: ALFREDA
turns.text: Can I get you something for the road?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You have orange whips?

turns.speaker: ALFREDA
turns.text: Orange who? Not from 'round here, are ya?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No. I'm from Akron.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Where can I find Buzz Fazeli?

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Whoa, cool your maples. Over the bridge, past the Peter Pan, last house on the dead end. Theo releases Sid's hand. Sid drops to his knees and cradles his damaged hand.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Haven't seen a ball like that since '69.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It belonged to my dad.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Look Sid, a Buzz Burger. The Faz's favorite lunch. Sid reaches for the plate. Buzz walks over to the booth  and pulls his burger away from Sid.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Hey, cut it out Sid, that tickles. I'm serious! You guys are related, right?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's my dad.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Heh, heh, heh.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You said it would be unethical to help me. You call dwarf bowling ethical!

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Sorry about your loss.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I should've pegged you guys for bowling dicks from day one.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: After we ID, we bury the body. Case and casket closed.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You tried to make it look like Junior trashed his place. Junior's underground in that coffin you dicks put him in.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: It's splitsville for you.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Hey, ain't I seen you on the tour?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: No, pinhead, he ain't here to bowl.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Fazeli...I don't know no Buzz Fazeli.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What do you want with old man Faz?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Yeah, basement bingo.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Lemme see your ball.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Ah, come on, lemme see your ball.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You afraid we're gonna steal it?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Three whips. To go.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: When you get a chance.

turns.speaker: BREEZE
turns.text: Hey, you still here?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: We're looking for Buzz Fazeli, seen him?
